activity.text:
Hi CARE team, @AdityaJ2305 

I’m super excited to jump into this issue with the Encounter Overview tab not rendering beyond 14 items—what a great challenge! I’ve been exploring CARE and love how it’s transforming healthcare management. With my background in ReactJS and Django (e.g., I optimized a React app to handle large datasets at Modern Vibe Homes), I’d love to tackle this and make those tables sing with all the data they deserve!

Here’s how I’d crush it:

1. **Diagnose the Limit**: Dig into the backend (likely Django) to confirm the 14-item cap—probably a pagination default in the API.
2. **Boost the Fetch**: Update the API endpoint to support dynamic limits (e.g., `?limit=50`) or fetch all items with a single call if feasible.
3. **Frontend Flow**: Tweak the React frontend to handle paginated or full data—maybe add a “Load More” button for smooth UX.
4. **Test the Fix**: Verify with the example encounter ([this link](https://care.ohc.network/facility/605215bd-6215-45dd-bc20-aaeceb474ca1/patient/f3d6590d-adcd-4e0d-9eb3-a5f003dbbee8/encounter/235e330a-4924-4c1a-a871-defead90a16c/updates)) to ensure all allergies show up.
5. **Polish It**: Optimize performance so it’s snappy even with 50+ items—because healthcare pros need speed!

This fix could unlock a seamless experience for users tracking tons of allergies or diagnoses—I’m pumped to see it through! Could I take a stab at a PR for this? I’m also eyeing GSoC 2025 with CARE—any chance to chat with the team about this or other ideas? Can’t wait to collab and boost CARE’s impact!

Thanks
